MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM.how_to_trigger: With Gale as an Avatar, or as orphaned Companion, approach the shrine of Mystra (S_LOW_MystraStatue_ab6b7142-2333-4b38-9506-fb3e72157145) and click on it.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM.how_to_trigger: With Gale as Companion, approach the shrine of Mystra (S_LOW_MystraStatue_ab6b7142-2333-4b38-9506-fb3e72157145) and click on it.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_32.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_32.text: *There she stands. Mystra. Your goddess. Your lover. Your past. And no ordinary idol.*

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_77.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_77.text: *Beneath the silent stone surges a relentless current of purest Weave. A summoning channel, the kind commanded by Mystra herself.*

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_53.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_53.text: *How many times have you dreamed of this moment? An audience with the goddess who loved you. Who abandoned you. All you have to do is reach for it...*

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_56.speaker: Karlach
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_56.text: You can do this, Gale. And I'll be right here when you're done.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_8.speaker: Jaheira
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_8.text: This is one lady love you perhaps do not want to keep waiting, wizard.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale reaches a hand out in front of him, closes his eyes. A brilliant flash of white light and - he's in the Outer planes. Before him, Mystra in her celestial form.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_72.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_72.text: Gale of Waterdeep. You look well.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_72.context: NodeContext: Not giving much away - both a pleasantry on an awkward reunion with her ex, and carrying the added implication of the fact Mystra told Gale to blow himself up, yet he stands before her, alive and well

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_112.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_112.text: Mystra. Please - I have so much to explain to you.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_26.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_26.text: There is much unsaid between us, but time runs ever short.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_26.context: NodeContext: "much unsaid' carries a lot of weight - could refer to their relationship, their breakup, Gale's betrayal etc. Mystra is subtly keeping control of the conversation.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_34.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_34.text: I've been watching your journey here. Your triumphs. Your temptations. Your doubts.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_34.context: NodeContext: Referring to the player's epic journey so far. They may have sensed Mystra's presence at an earlier point in the game, and been tempted to use evil magic she forbids her followers to use. They may also have spoken of their faltering faith in Mystra, but she has no interest in judging them for it now.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_59.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_59.text: You discovered what lies at the Heart of the Absolute - the Crown of Karsus - and you disobeyed my instruction. Why?
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_59.context: NodeContext: Big question - this was the quest Mystra gave to the player in Act 2, which they refused to complete. Mystra containing her frustration, but needs to know the answer. 'Heart of the Absolute' was the term used for what turned out to be the brain/Crown

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_126.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_126.text: Because I have someone else to live for.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_62.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_62.text: I know. Your union is one I find surprising, but you are your own man and it is not the worst choice you have made, after all.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_62.context: NodeContext: Not news to Mystra. Partner could be any origin/custom player so it's intentionally generic. 'Worst choice' alluding to how he got the orb in his chest.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_5.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_5.text: Because my life isn't yours to throw away. You had no right to ask that of me.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_91.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_91.text: You were my lover, my Chosen, yet still you know so little of me.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_91.context: NodeContext: Hint of disappointment - even after all the advantages I gave you, you can't see further than your own nose

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_108.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_108.text: I was afraid. Afraid to die. Afraid that I might fail.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_21.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_21.text: Fear? An 'unambitious emotion', you once told me. Have you changed after all?
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_21.context: NodeContext: Reminding Gale of his former hubris. Not yet ready to believe he's changed.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_28.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_28.text: I hoped hindsight would help you see what you could not perceive before. Do you understand why I severed our connection?
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_28.context: NodeContext: Containing her emotions, probing to see if Gale can be trusted with her next request

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_22.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_22.text: I was a danger to you. What I did, or rather, attempted to do, was reckless.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_132.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_132.text: It was, more than you ever realised.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_132.context: NodeContext: Not letting him off easily

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_92.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_92.text: Because I disobeyed you. You punished me for it.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_104.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_104.text: How so? You think I should have cured you? Erased the consequences of your actions?
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_104.context: NodeContext: Not impressed at Gale's characterisation of his actions and her response, but not rising to it. She's about to correct him.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_102.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_102.text: I let you down. I was a fool, and fools don't deserve the love of a goddess.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_103.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_103.text: The past cannot be undone with self-pity, nor can a future be forged. Only with the truth will you see the way ahead.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_103.context: NodeContext: Not letting him off easily

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_81.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_81.text: You were threatened. You realised you couldn't control me.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_55.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_55.text: You were many things to me, but never a threat. And never a saviour.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_55.context: NodeContext: Sharper, almost a warning - don't entertain such thoughts, Gale. You won't like where they lead.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_27.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_27.text: Our relationship bored you. The orb was just an excuse to end it.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_54.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_54.text: I have no need of excuses. Nonetheless, you gave me one I had no choice but to act upon.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_54.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact regarding Gale's explanation. The 'excuse' he gave was the orb, she's about to explain.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_69.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_69.text: The fragment of magic you tried to return to me was not of my creation. It was the Karsite Weave.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_69.context: NodeContext: 'Fragment of magic' referring to the orb in Gale's chest. 'Karsite Weave' with distaste - the creation of someone she hates

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_19.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_19.text: It is a corrupted, half-born magic wrought in the brief moment Karsus ascended to godhood. It hungers for power just as he did, and it can never be sated.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_19.context: NodeContext: Weighty/strong sentiment here - the Karsite Weave is an abomination in her eyes

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_11.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_11.text: You unleashed something that would consume all magic in existence, and yet you thought only of preserving yourself.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_11.context: NodeContext: 'Am I wrong?'. Referring back to Gale unleashing the orb, and then coming to Mystra to ask her to cure him of it.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_43.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_43.text: So that's what you're scared of. The magic within me is one you can't control. But with the Crown of Karsus, I could.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_107.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_107.text: You can no more control the Karsite Weave than a weather vane could control a storm.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_107.context: NodeContext: A personal warning for Gale, but not specifically that 'he' couldn't control it - no mortal could. Stern, warning

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_79.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_79.text: I never intended to do harm. Only to prove myself worthy of you.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_13.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_13.text: You were already worthy. What you lacked was patience, and it cost you dearly.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_13.context: NodeContext: Hint of gentleness - recognising some of Gale's pain

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_20.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_20.text: When the Karsite Weave entered your body, your gifts were the first thing it consumed.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_20.context: NodeContext: Hint of gentleness - recognising some of Gale's pain

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_137.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_137.text: Then why did you strip me of my abilities? I could have put things right.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_42.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_42.text: I did no such thing, Gale.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_42.context: NodeContext: Slight confusion - she didn't know this was his assumption

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_141.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_141.text: You're one to talk. How many innocents were you prepared to sacrifice if I detonated the orb?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_109.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_109.text: Such eddies are unexceptional. Souls arrive and depart your plane with every tide, in circumstances just and unjust.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_109.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact, not interested in these kinds of specifics

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_41.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_41.text: The Weave cannot be lost because we are unwilling to cause a ripple. And that is what is at stake.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_41.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact, not interested in these kinds of specifics. 'The Weave' = magic.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_24.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_24.text: Is that why you lied to me about the Crown of Karsus? Self-preservation?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_71.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_71.text: My concern was the preservation of everything. The Karsite Weave could tear apart the very fabric of the Material Plane.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_71.context: NodeContext: A hint of anger here - Gale's selfishness is not her own, he's pissing her off by accusing her of these motives

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_15.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_15.text: That it entered your body and consumed no more than your powers was a miracle. But we will not be granted another.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_15.context: NodeContext: A hint of anger here - Gale's selfishness is not her own, he's pissing her off by accusing her of these motives. The 'miracle' is that Gale didn't do any more damage, not that he survived. Sense of foreboding on the last sentence.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_97.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_97.text: The only reason the 'orb' sleeps is because I have allowed it to feed on the true Weave - a temporary measure, but one that will not be enough to save us.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_97.context: NodeContext: "This is what your foolishness has cost". New information for the player, who believes Mystra simply waved her hand and fixed them because it suited her.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_142.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_142.text: With each day that passes, the elder brain threatens to become a new kind of god, its worshippers a scourge of soulless illithids.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_142.context: NodeContext: Hinting at the fact the elder brain will soon evolve, becoming free of the dead three's control. A terrible vision for the future.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_110.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_110.text: If you will not use the orb to end this abomination, then you must find a way to separate Crown and host. When you've done this, you must surrender the Crown of Karsus to me.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_30.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_30.text: Perform this service, and I will see you cured. You will be forgiven.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_30.context: NodeContext: Key info for players - this is the first time they've been offered a cure,

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_89.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_89.text: You're the mother of all magic, the Weave incarnate. Can't you just destroy the Crown yourself?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_9.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_9.text: It is not my place to destroy another god's creation, however temporarily he joined the pantheon.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_9.context: NodeContext: Hint of frustration that this is the case

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_101.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_101.text: It must be you, Gale. You are the one who carries Karsus' power within you. You are the only one who can.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_101.context: NodeContext: Hint of frustration that this is the case

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_128.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_128.text: Very well. The next time we meet, I'll be bringing you the Crown.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_38.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_38.text: Thank you. May the Weave's light guide your purpose, and its wisdom guide your hand.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_38.context: NodeContext: A blessing - Mystra relieved you'll do it

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_6.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_6.text: The future of magic rests on your shoulders, Gale of Waterdeep.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_6.context: NodeContext: Almost like a 'knighting' vibe - she's declaring her faith in him, and believes he can do this.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_31.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_31.text: I promise you - it is a burden you are strong enough to bear.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_31.context: NodeContext: Almost like a 'knighting' vibe - she's declaring her faith in him, and believes he can do this.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystra's form disappears. Gale stands in an ordinary temple before an ordinary statue once more. Mystra's idol gazes on, revealing nothing. Gale smiles to himself.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_122.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_122.text: I understand now why you asked what you did. I should use the orb, and ensure Karsus' powers are truly destroyed.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_87.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_87.text: If this is the course you choose, Elysium will be waiting.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_87.context: NodeContext: A promise. 'Elysium' being heaven/where Mystra resides

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_49.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_49.text: I don't need your forgiveness. The Crown of Karsus will be mine, and the Karsite Weave will obey me.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_95.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_95.text: Crown yourself, Gale Dekarios, and you will learn what it is to carry such weight upon your shoulders.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_95.context: NodeContext: An icy edge entering her voice - a hint at the challenge Gale will face if he pursues this course

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_121.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_121.text: If it does not crush you, I will.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_121.context: NodeContext: Here we glimpse the true, unimaginable power of Mystra. She's still in control of herself, but her anger should be palpable.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_82.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_82.text: I don't know. I need time to think.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_61.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_61.text: So be it. Follow the needle of your own wisdom. We shall see how truly it leads you.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_61.context: NodeContext: Neutral - not impressed he hasn't outright agreed to what she asked, but willing to give him the time he needs.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_86.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_86.text: No wizard worth their hat would destroy such a powerful artefact without first understanding it.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_127.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_127.text: And you believe you have the right to such an understanding?
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_127.context: NodeContext: Hint of an eyebrow raise - is this a sign of Gale's same old hubris?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_117.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_117.text: I owe you no explanation. Not after how you've treated me.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_93.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_93.text: You still believe yourself to be so wronged? You always were stubborn.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_93.context: NodeContext: Hint of an eyebrow raise - is this a sign of Gale's same old hubris?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_16.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_16.text: You break up with me, cut me off from the Weave, leave me to die, and that's all you have to say? 'You look well'?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_123.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_123.text: I did not come here to suffer a mortal's admonitions. Certainly not yours.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_123.context: NodeContext: restrained, but taking no nonsense

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_2.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_2.text: What can I say? Adventuring suits me.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_135.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_135.text: It always did. Though the ones we shared were far sweeter than those you've tasted recently.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_135.context: NodeContext: Alluding to the wider plot of the story - that Gale's recently been infected with a tadpole etc. Not overly nostalgic here - she's invoking the 'sweetness' in comparison to the recent chaos Gle's endured, not because she's remembering the sweetness herself

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_47.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_47.text: Tactful as ever. But now it is only your candour I require.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_47.context: NodeContext: 'Tactful' referring just to how he's handling the situation with dignity. Mystra in control of the conversation.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_18.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_18.text: I didn't come for small talk. Why did you summon me?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_136.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_136.text: I see you lost your manners, along with the greatest of your gifts.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_136.context: NodeContext: Not really rising to it, but the slightest hint of an eyebrow raise. She's here for more important things that such bickering.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_68.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_68.text: I didn't call on you to make small talk. You owe me an explanation.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_44.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_44.text: *Something in the air grows colder. Sharper. Mystra's patience is extensive, but not infinite. She will not wait forever.*

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_14.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_14.text: Your goddess awaits. Hear her out, but remember that you do not owe her obedience, and you certainly do not owe her your life.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_73.speaker: Lae'zel
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_73.text: Your goddess calls. Serve her or denounce her as you will - but you cannot ignore her.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_83.speaker: Wyll
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_83.text: Go on, my good man - your goddess awaits. Let us pray that good wisdom prevails.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_124.speaker: Shadowheart
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_124.text: Go on, Gale - see what Mystra has to say for herself. She was never deserving of your worship, anyway.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_124.context: NodeContext: Encouraging  Gale. 'Standing up to a goddess' = SH has turned from Shar. 'see what Mystra...' = SH loyal to Shar (Mystra is typically not a popular goddess with Shar worshippers)

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_131.speaker: Astarion
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_131.text: Well? Go on, then - it's rude to keep a goddess waiting.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_133.speaker: Minsc
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_133.text: Eh... the first step is difficult, of course. Minsc could throw you in, if you prefer?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_139.speaker: Halsin
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_139.text: Speak your mind, Gale. Let go of that weight you have been carrying for Mystra.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_35.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_35.text: *Just as Elminster promised, you stand before no ordinary idol.*

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_57.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_57.text: *Just as Elminster promised, Gale stands before no ordinary idol.*
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale looks up at Mystra's statue, his face unreadable

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_84.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_84.text: *All he has to do is reach for it...*

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_70.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_70.text: *There she stands. Mystra. Gale's goddess. His lover. His past. And no ordinary idol.*
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale looks up at Mystra's statue, his face unreadable

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_74.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_74.text: Mystra. I never thought we'd speak again like this. Why am I here?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_148.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_148.text: No thanks to you. I wasn't expecting a summons, but then you did always prefer things on your terms.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_80.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_80.text: As do you. But I assume we're not here solely to exchange compliments. So, why am I here?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_39.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_39.text: I didn't want to die. And when I saw the Crown, I thought I might not have to, if I only understood its power.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_99.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_99.text: That can't be. It wasn't - it couldn't have been. I only wished to prove myself worthy. I had no idea...

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_12.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_12.text: Well somebody had to. You weren't exactly forthcoming with any offers of help.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_37.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_37.text: I won't let you down again. When the Absolute is vanquished, I will surrender Karsus' powers to you. You have my word.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_106.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_106.text: Not happening. When I get my hands on that Crown, I'm going to wield it. Karsus' powers will be mine.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_116.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_116.text: A great ask indeed. You've given me much to think on - as you always did.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_119.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_119.text: So that's what you're scared of. With the Crown of Karsus reforged, I could take control of the Karsite Weave.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_67.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_67.text: You abandoned me in my hour of greatest need. I had no obligation to help you in yours.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_114.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_114.text: Because you had no right to ask that of me. You cast me out, remember?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_21.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_21.text: *There she stands, just as Elminster promised. Mystra. Goddess of the Weave. Mother of all magic.*
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player gazes up at the statue of Mystra. She appears beautiful, imposing, indifferent.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_54.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_54.text: The old man wasn't lying. She's opened a summoning channel. Can't you feel it?
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale looks at the statue of MystraNodeContext: Can't quite believe it

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_61.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_61.text: *Gale's right. The very air around the statue crackles with magic, as though the Weave itself were coursing beneath her stony skin.*

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_117.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_117.text: A stream of pure, undiluted Weave. I only have to reach out, and it will carry me to Mystra, wherever she may be.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_99.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_99.text: *Gale's right. The very air around the statue crackles with magic. It sets your teeth on edge.*

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_64.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_64.text: *There she stands. Mystra. Goddess of the Weave. Mother of all magic.*
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player gazes up at the statue of Mystra. She appears beautiful, imposing, indifferent.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_75.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_75.text: Strange... Do you feel that? It's as though the Weave itself is rushing past us...

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_29.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_29.text: It's a summoning channel, the kind Mystra once used to call me to her side. I only have to reach for it, and it will take me to her side.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_3.speaker: Jaheira
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_3.text: Well? Are you composing a poem in your head, or some such?
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_3.context: NodeContext: Impatient, but in an amused way. Gale is suddenly shy about answering his goddess / lover's call.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_63.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_63.text: Time was I'd have given my right arm for a chance to speak with Mystra again. The left one too. Maybe a knee...

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_83.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player nods firmly in response

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_43.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_43.text: You're right. I am a strong, capable wizard. And this is no more than a casual reunion with an ex-lover.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_70.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_70.context: NodeContext: It's getting on top of hi again, he's getting nervous again

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_51.speaker: Player
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_51.text: You don't owe her so much as a fingernail. She asked you to blow yourself up.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_95.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_95.text: Not the message one hopes to receive from a past lover. But her first love was always the Weave. At best, I was a close second.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_97.speaker: Player
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_97.text: I don't think she's that kind of goddess.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_12.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_12.text: Thankfully not. Though she's not been averse to demanding the odd human sacrifice in recent days, has she?
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_12.context: NodeContext: black humour, referring to the fact she asked him to blow himself up

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_68.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_68.text: When I pictured this moment, I thought I'd feel more in control. Yet here I am, with palms sweatier than a bugbear's armpit.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_46.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_46.text: I always wondered what being nervous would feel like. I hate it.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_108.speaker: Player
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_108.text: Do you know what you're going to say to her?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_115.speaker: Player
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_115.text: Of all the things to be nervous about, an audience with a goddess seems reasonable.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_102.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_102.text: You're kind to say so, but this is hardly my first time in Mystra's presence. It's more the matter of what I'm going to say to her.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_76.speaker: Player
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_76.text: Why do you care what she thinks of you?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_1.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_1.text: You know what it is to worship her, to respect her, to love her...

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_48.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_48.text: It was intoxicating. An experience beyond expression.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_80.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_80.text: During my time locked away in Waterdeep, I prepared a quite comprehensive speech for her on the subject of our former relationship, and the manner in which it ended.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_15.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_15.text: Alas, recent events have rendered the majority of it moot, so I'm going to have to improvise. Unless you have any words of wisdom to impart before I go?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_11.speaker: Player
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_11.text: You're not taking me with you?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_13.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_13.text: The summoning channel Mystra has provided is for me alone. No one else is permitted to enter it, no matter how talented a user of the Weave they are.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_27.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_27.text: The summoning channel Mystra has provided is one only I can enter. No matter how much I'd prefer not to face her alone.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_72.speaker: Player
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_72.text: Seek her forgiveness, Gale. It might be your only hope of curing the orb.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_105.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_105.text: Mystra's forgiveness? If you want me to claim the Crown of Karsus, she'll hardly be in a forgiving mood after that.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_107.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_107.text: I think it's best I keep a cool head going into this. Approach it like a particularly high-risk round of Three-Dragon Ante.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_5.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_5.text: I'll let Mystra show her flight, and then I can see how strong a chance we stand of winning the gambit.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_5.context: NodeContext: 'Ante' and 'flight' are terms used in a d&d equivalent of poker. 'flight' = cards and 'gambitt' = round.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_40.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_40.text: I'll only be gone for a matter of moments. The Outer Planes experience time quite differently to our own.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_52.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_52.text: You're right. A heartfelt apology is the surest way to a goddess' heart, and her favour.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_18.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_18.text: I'd pray that she'll be in a forgiving mood, if she weren't the one I'd be praying to.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_35.speaker: Player
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_35.text: Make her squirm. Tell her the Crown will be ours soon enough.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_23.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_23.text: With pleasure. It's not often one has the chance to threaten a goddess and make good on it.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_90.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_90.text: Mystra won't be the one issuing the orders for much longer. She'll know exactly who's coming for her.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_59.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_59.text: This won't take long, and when I'm done, I'll be free of Mystra's yoke once and for all.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale reaches a hand out in front of him, closes his eyes. A brilliant flash of white light and - he's in the Outer planes. Before him, Mystra in her celestial form.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_45.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_45.text: Gale of Waterdeep. You look well.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_45.context: NodeContext: Not giving much away - both a pleasantry on an awkward reunion with her ex, and carrying the added implication of the fact Mystra told Gale to blow himself up, yet he stands before her, alive and well

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_41.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_41.text: Mystra. I never thought we'd speak again like this. Why am I here?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_73.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_73.text: There is much unsaid between us, but time runs ever short.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_73.context: NodeContext: "much unsaid' carries a lot of weight - could refer to their relationship, their breakup, Gale's betrayal etc. Mystra is subtly keeping control of the conversation.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_26.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_26.text: You discovered what lies at the Heart of the Absolute - the Crown of Karsus - and you disobeyed my instruction. Why?
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_26.context: NodeContext: Big question - this was the quest Mystra gave to the player in Act 2, which they refused to complete. Mystra containing her frustration, but needs to know the answer. 'Heart of the Absolute' was the term used for what turned out to be the brain/Crown

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_112.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_112.text: I didn't want to die. And when I saw the Crown, I thought I might not have to, if I only understood its power.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_0.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_0.text: And you believe you have the right to such an understanding?
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_0.context: NodeContext: Hint of an eyebrow raise - is this a sign of Gale's same old hubris?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_49.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_49.text: The past cannot be undone with self-pity, nor can a future be forged. Only with the truth will you see the way ahead.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_49.context: NodeContext: Not letting him off easily

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_30.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_30.text: The fragment of magic you tried to return to me was not of my creation. It was the Karsite Weave.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_30.context: NodeContext: 'Fragment of magic' referring to the orb in Gale's chest. 'Karsite Weave' with distaste - the creation of someone she hates

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_4.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_4.text: It is a corrupted, half-born magic wrought in the brief moment Karsus ascended to godhood. It hungers for power just as he did, and it can never be sated.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_4.context: NodeContext: Weighty/strong sentiment here - the Karsite Weave is an abomination in her eyes

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_22.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_22.text: You unleashed something that would consume all magic in existence, and yet you thought only of preserving yourself.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_22.context: NodeContext: 'Am I wrong?'. Referring back to Gale unleashing the orb, and then coming to Mystra to ask her to cure him of it.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_88.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_88.text: That can't be. It wasn't - it couldn't have been. I only wished to prove myself worthy. I had no idea...

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_25.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_25.text: You were already worthy. What you lacked was patience, and it cost you dearly.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_25.context: NodeContext: Hint of gentleness - recognising some of Gale's pain

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_24.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_24.text: When the Karsite Weave entered your body, your gifts were the first thing it consumed.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_24.context: NodeContext: Hint of gentleness - recognising some of Gale's pain

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_55.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_55.text: The only reason the 'orb' sleeps is because I have allowed it to feed on the true Weave - a temporary measure, but one that will not be enough to save us.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_55.context: NodeContext: "This is what your foolishness has cost". New information for the player, who believes Mystra simply waved her hand and fixed them because it suited her.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_66.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_66.text: With each day that passes, the elder brain threatens to become a new kind of god, its worshippers a scourge of soulless illithids.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_66.context: NodeContext: Hinting at the fact the elder brain will soon evolve, becoming free of the dead three's control. A terrible vision for the future.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_47.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_47.text: If you will not use the orb to end this abomination, then you must find a way to separate Crown and host. When you've done this, you must surrender the Crown of Karsus to me.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_57.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_57.text: I won't let you down again. When the Absolute is vanquished, I will surrender Karsus' powers to you. You have my word.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_86.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_86.text: Thank you. May the Weave's light guide your purpose, and its wisdom guide your hand.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_86.context: NodeContext: A blessing - Mystra relieved you'll do it

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_9.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_9.text: The future of magic rests on your shoulders, Gale of Waterdeep.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_9.context: NodeContext: Almost like a 'knighting' vibe - she's declaring her faith in him, and believes he can do this.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_10.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_10.text: I promise you - it is a burden you are strong enough to bear.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_10.context: NodeContext: Almost like a 'knighting' vibe - she's declaring her faith in him, and believes he can do this.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystra's form disappears. Gale stands in an ordinary temple before an ordinary statue once more. Mystra's idol gazes on, revealing nothing. Gale smiles to himself.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_114.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_114.text: Not happening. When I get my hands on that Crown, I'm going to wield it. Karsus' powers will be mine.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_113.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_113.text: Crown yourself, Gale Dekarios, and you will learn what it is to carry such weight upon your shoulders.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_113.context: NodeContext: An icy edge entering her voice - a hint at the challenge Gale will face if he pursues this course

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_78.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_78.text: If it does not crush you, I will.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_78.context: NodeContext: Here we glimpse the true, unimaginable power of Mystra. She's still in control of herself, but her anger should be palpable.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_36.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_36.text: A great ask indeed. You've given me much to think on - as you always did.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_65.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_65.text: So be it. Follow the needle of your own wisdom. We shall see how truly it leads you.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_65.context: NodeContext: Neutral - not impressed he hasn't outright agreed to what she asked, but willing to give him the time he needs.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_62.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_62.text: Well somebody had to. You weren't exactly forthcoming with any offers of help.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_44.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_44.text: My concern was the preservation of everything. The Karsite Weave could tear apart the very fabric of the Material Plane.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_44.context: NodeContext: A hint of anger here - Gale's selfishness is not her own, he's pissing her off by accusing her of these motives

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_100.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_100.text: That it entered your body and consumed no more than your powers was a miracle. But we will not be granted another.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_100.context: NodeContext: A hint of anger here - Gale's selfishness is not her own, he's pissing her off by accusing her of these motives. The 'miracle' is that Gale didn't do any more damage, not that he survived. Sense of foreboding on the last sentence.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_7.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_7.text: So that's what you're scared of. With the Crown of Karsus reforged, I could take control of the Karsite Weave.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_60.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_60.text: You can no more control the Karsite Weave than a weather vane could control a storm.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_60.context: NodeContext: A personal warning for Gale, but not specifically that 'he' couldn't control it - no mortal could. Stern, warning

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_8.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_8.text: You abandoned me in my hour of greatest need. I had no obligation to help you in yours.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_71.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_71.text: You still believe yourself to be so wronged? You always were stubborn.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_71.context: NodeContext: Hint of an eyebrow raise - is this a sign of Gale's same old hubris?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_17.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_17.text: Because you had no right to ask that of me. You cast me out, remember?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_19.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_19.text: You were my lover, my Chosen, yet still you know so little of me.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_19.context: NodeContext: Hint of disappointment - even after all the advantages I gave you, you can't see further than your own nose

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_50.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_50.text: No thanks to you. I wasn't expecting a summons, but then you did always prefer things on your terms.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_87.speaker: Mystra
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_87.text: I did not come here to suffer a mortal's admonitions. Certainly not yours.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_87.context: NodeContext: restrained, but taking no nonsense

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_103.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_103.text: As do you. But I assume we're not here solely to exchange compliments. So, why am I here?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_20.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_20.text: It's one thing for us to actually pursue the Crown. I'm not entirely sure I want to threaten Mystra with the prospect on her own turf, so to speak.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_58.speaker: Player
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_58.text: Don't give anything away. Just find out what she has to say.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_93.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_93.text: You'd make a fine Three-Dragon Ante player, you know.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_77.speaker: Player
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_77.text: You shouldn't go to her, Gale. Don't give her the satisfaction.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_111.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_111.text: What do you mean? I've been waiting for an opportunity like this since long before our paths crossed.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_104.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_104.text: This is my only opportunity to learn the truth. About the Crown, the orb, all of it. Why try to keep me from it?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_109.speaker: Player
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_109.text: You're right. If you want to go, you should go.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_91.speaker: Player
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_91.text: Even with the orb, you're one of the best wizards in the Realms. You don't need Mystra's help.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_84.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_84.text: Fine. If you're so against the idea, I suppose we can forge ahead without input from the goddess of magic.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_79.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_79.text: I'm sure she has nothing pertinent to share whatsoever.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_96.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_96.text: Confident almost to the point of arrogance I may be, but in this matter I know she'll have wisdom to share. As for whether I choose to act upon it... we shall see.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_74.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_74.text: I don't suppose you can imagine what it's like, to have your god as your lover...

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_106.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_106.text: For a wizard, to have the love of the goddess of magic herself...

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_85.speaker: Player
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_85.text: Pull it together. You're going to make a fool of yourself otherwise.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_56.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_56.text: Oh that hardly matters. There's not much further I could fall in Mystra's estimation. But I'd like to at least leave her with something to think about.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_42.speaker: Player
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_42.text: I'd give more than a few limbs to be summoned to Mystra's presence, to look on the Mother of Magic herself...

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_37.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_37.text: You have more faith in her than even I did... Understandable, though, when you have not loved her as deeply, or known the depths of her affections.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_6.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_6.text: Your goddess awaits. Hear her out, but remember that you do not owe her obedience, and you certainly do not owe her your life.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_38.speaker: Lae'zel
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_38.text: Your goddess calls. Serve her or denounce her as you will - but you cannot ignore her.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_39.speaker: Wyll
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_39.text: Go on, my good man. You can't exactly deny a goddess, now can you?

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_82.speaker: Shadowheart
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_82.text: Mystra is a lesser goddess compared to Lady Shar, but if you have a chance to speak to her, you should seize it.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_82.context: NodeContext: 'An audience with your goddess ' = SH has turned from Shar. 'Mystra is a lesser goddess' = SH is loyal to Shar.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_94.speaker: Astarion
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_94.text: Well? Go on, then - it's rude to keep a goddess waiting.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_110.speaker: Minsc
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_110.text: Eh... the first step is difficult, of course. Minsc could throw you in, if you prefer?
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_110.context: NodeContext: Genuinely being helpful. Gale stands wondering whether to answer Mystra's summoning portal.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_118.speaker: Halsin
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_118.text: Do what you must, Gale. Mystra has weighed upon your heart and mind for too long.

MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_33.speaker: Karlach
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_33.text: Go on then, Gale. We'll be here waiting for you when you're finished.
MystraShrine_OM_Gale_COM_33.context: NodeContext: Encouraging, like telling a friend to go chat to their ex while you wait in the car ready to debrief after.
